website_summaries.verdict: Its convenient features and durable construction put the EEZ-Y at the top of our list for the best available today.
pros: Double canopy allows air to move through it rather than inverting the umbrella
cons: Automatic button works, but still takes some strength to close the umbrella

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this umbrella since I was tired of having my umbrella's ripped to shreds by NYC winds on rainy, cold days. Just as luck would have it, two days after it was delivered, we had one of those cold, windy, very wet winter days. The umbrella held up perfectly in the gusting winds and kept me relatively dry.
customer_reviews.author: Titus

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - DYE RUNS
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this umbrella having read many positive reviews. It was to my dismay when i was walking outside with it, in the rain, to notice that not only were my hands stained in blue dye, but my dress shirt was ruined as well. The only logical queation is, who builds or sells an umbrella, with dye that runs from water??????????
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Baconator

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up 👍🏼
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this umbrella it fits in my lunch bag and purses easily. It opens and closes quickly and since I walk the a cane not having to fight to get my umbrella opened is a plus. It large enough to cover me and my bags so thumbs up for the product.
customer_reviews.author: MTF

customer_reviews.title: good choice
customer_reviews.text: it is portable and sturdy. I chooses the dark green finally, and I love the burgundy as well. It's a difficult choice. It would be perfect if the handle is longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jing

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great service
customer_reviews.text: When I received my EEZ-Y compact travel umbrella, I noticed it felt "professional". The components were of good quality and it appeared to be well made. After a year in my backseat, I noticed that one of the spines on the umbrella would no longer fold, and it prevented the umbrella from completely collapsing so that it could be fastened closed. I had registered the umbrella within the first 30 days after purchasing it, so I emailed EEZ-Y customer service. They responded within minutes, even though it was in the evening. I explained the situation and sent a couple of photos to demonstrate. In less than a week, I received a brand-new replacement! Yea EEZ-Y!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superstar of umbrellas!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG, this umbrella is incredible! It's sooo solid and sturdy. The auto pop up works perfectly and the double canopy is awesome! I never had a double canopy before but I'm so glad I got this one. I've bought 2 other junky umbrellas at local stores recently (with zero success) and I'm so happy to have found a solid umbrella with the EEZ-Y! Third times a charm!
customer_reviews.author: mary mac

customer_reviews.title: How to Get That "Warranty" Honored
customer_reviews.text: My umbrella seemed sturdy but has turned inside out more that once during heavy, gusty downtown winds. The products says they have a lifetime warranty which is why I bought it over others, but after thoroughly searching I cannot find any customer service number on Amazon and they haven't responded to my message. If they do and replace the umbrella, I'd change this review to 5 stars because THEN it would be worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. KT

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for the price & customer service
customer_reviews.text: Cheap but gets the job done. Very short pole. Ripped within a month ***Update as of Jan ‘19: updated from 3 stars to 4 after a terrific experience with customer service. I had originally put 3 stars for an average, cheap but functional product. After posting, a customer service rep contacted me and provided me with a replacement umbrella. It shipped quickly and has so far held up against windy, rainy NY January. I will continue to purchase this product for the service alone. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: MBL

customer_reviews.title: Came defective, impossible to close.
customer_reviews.text: It cane damaged. When I first tried to open it, it wouldn’t open all the way, and when it finally did almost open all the way, I saw one of the metal structures came broken. It’s also sooooo difficult to close it. It wouldn’t click back and kept on trying to open. It should be this hard to close an umbrella. It sucks I got the bad defective one when 70% seem to have no issues. I’m returning this crap.
customer_reviews.author: Christine J.

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I had written a review explaining exactly how it broke the first time I took it out on a rainy day. Some random email address contacted me saying they will offer me $30 if I delete the comment. I did then informed them via email. Few days after not hearing back from them, I tried emailing them again...Turns out the email address was no longer valid. Well, here I am again to tell you this umbrella will not protect you against anything at all but the sales team will definitely waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: BROKE AFTER ONE USE! GARBAGE!!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my dad because he wanted a fancier umbrella. we read "premium fiberglass" and thought it would be lightweight and robust, more so than the hollow steel umbrellas that bend easily. it hasn't rained here in months until earlier this week and, today, the second time my father's ever even opened the umbrella, two of the "premium fiberglass" arms snapped! premium? are you serious? this umbrella has never even seen rain and its already broken. how could this possibly resist "55mph wind gusts" if it cant even be opened without breaking? $20 is not a lot of money but this thing is complete garbage. saving your money and just buying a raincoat would be an EEZ-Y-er decision.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Rusty and heavy
customer_reviews.text: For a travel umbrella, this is considerably larger and heavier than other travel umbrellas I own. Also, I used it once on a rainy day in Portland and it wasn't completely wind-proof. The wind still wanted to pull it out of my hands and I felt a big gust would either carry it away or turn it inside out. Most disappointing of all is after one use, the ribs started to rust.... guess it's not very waterproof. *eye roll*
customer_reviews.author: seasoned traveler

customer_reviews.title: What rain!?!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Southern California, and let's be honest...we don't get much rain. But sun, we got lots and lots of that. This umbrella provides plenty of protection for walks around the park or wherever. I was drawn to this umbrella because of it's one touch feature...AND IT DID NOT DISAPPOINT! This is so easy to use, my 5 year old can easily open and close it. It's small enough to carry in a bag or backpack to have just in case. Will definitely be buying more for each of my kids, so i don't have to share.
customer_reviews.author: Diana R. Ferree

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price and then some
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a portable umbrella for some traveling I did recently. I wanted something small and sturdy. Originally I considered just a $5 or less umbrella from a local store but I wanted it to hold up to wind. While in Europe I saw a lot of other umbrellas stuffed in trash cans or laying next to them and even saw a few flip inside out from strong winds. The venting on this prevented it from yanking my arm in strong winds and the strong ribs stopped it from breaking in those winds. The push-button worked for opening and closing. I highly recommend this umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: GregP

customer_reviews.title: Portable and Sturdy Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I got this umbrella in navy blue. The button on the umbrella makes it easy to open and close the canopy. This umbrella does a great job at protecting me from the sun and the rain especially since I live in Florida. The umbrella comes with a cover which I often use to protect the umbrella canopy from breaking; it also helps with making the umbrella more compact. This umbrella measures a little over 11 inches as shown in the picture that I posted. It also comes with a strap at the end which can be used to hang the umbrella. Overall, I am very pleased with the quality and size of this umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzie M.

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Umbrella Holds Up to High Winds
customer_reviews.text: Excellent umbrella. After having used it for a few months now it has held up very well to wind and rain. It seems to be a very high quality umbrella and if I had to say anything negative about it, it’s that the spring can be a bit strong for some. Also it is a little heavier than those cheap umbrellas you find for $8 but I think it will last years longer than them using better quality materials. Overall I really like the umbrella and actually ended up buying 4 of them for my friends and one for my wife. If you’re tired of buying cheap umbrellas that last a few months, I can happily recommend this umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: I Like StuffTop Contributor: Action Figures

customer_reviews.title: Great for on-campus use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who walks all over campus at college. I chose this particular one because 1)price 2)good ratings from other users 3) compact size for coverage area, and 4) most importantly, it's vented to reduce the chance of turning inside out in strong winds. A typical male college student, my son didn't think he'd ever carry an umbrella, but after using once he was sold and carries it with him in the water bottle pocket on his daypack if there's a chance of rain. If something happens to this one, I'll replace it with the same one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Whitmire

customer_reviews.title: A Zillion times better than Totes
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to replace a very expensive Totes umbrella which was used twice and blew inside out in a moderate windy rainstorm. This umbrella is about 1/3 the price of the Totes and is incredibly better! Although I haven't used it in Iwindy conditions it is much sturdier and with the double canopy I can see that it will be much more wind resistance. Plus it has a lifetime guarantee. I reccomend this item highly
customer_reviews.author: Aunt Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Easy open/easy close
customer_reviews.text: The EEZ-Y windproof travel umbrella is aptly named. With a sImple touch, the umbrella opens up. With another touch, it closes easily. I have had umbrellas that are easy open but I struggle to close them. With one touch, this umbrella closes! The umbrella is well-made with actual springs that help the umbrella open and close. It is small enough to fit inside a purse or tote, yet large enough to cover yourself well in the rain. The thickness of the material holds up against even the heaviest of rain. The handle has a nice grip with a strap so you can carry it if needed. I would highly recommend this umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: It will embarass you!
customer_reviews.text: Open violently and threw the cap off the enter piece which went flying accross the room the first time I opened it. Does not close completely automatically as claimed. Can not put the umbrella in it's case (stuff sack) after it closes. It is heavy. This is an issue because I bought it to go long distance hiking. On the positive side it is small and does take up much room. I rarely write reviews but this product is so far off the mark I made an exception.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Not even wind resistent. Challenge to close.
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like a good size choice . . . it is however smaller than expected. That part would be okay if it were easier to use and provided the actual function for which it was intended. 1. It is NOT wind proof, it flips inside out with minor gusts. Minor gusts, like 6-8 mph. About as sturdy as the cheapie umbrellas you can get on a street corner in any major city during a rain storm. 2. It is difficult to close, particularly when it is wet. This makes for awkward lobby situations. Required both hands and arms to push the stalk into the handle. No one wants to fight an umbrella. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen mckeon

customer_reviews.title: What's with these positive reviews?
customer_reviews.text: I read tons of reviews on this - was looking for an EASY open and close for my elderly mother. This product was NEITHER. It was impossible for her to close and she needed 2 hands and still had trouble closing it. When she opened it, the "vents" on the top did not open properly and she had to "arrange" it. Overall, my mom said, "It was a lot of work! I can't use this!" Seems strange this product has thousands of positive reviews when the entire product was not at all as described. My mom did say, "It's very pretty."
customer_reviews.author: Maryellen H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: We have had a few rainy days lately and this umbrella proved very useful. It is very compact, yet larger than most compact umbrellas. It is easy to open and close and provides protection from the rain. I was able to use it on a walk with my baby and it did the job just fine. Material appears to be good and it seems to be sturdy. We also just had the windiest April in our history (according to the news) and the days I used it, the gusts did not flip my umbrella. This umbrella will be a great addition to my purse, but will also be great for a child's book bag.
customer_reviews.author: Catina J.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Want an umbrella that hold up to those gusts of wind we experience from time to time? Then this sturdy, compact umbrella is it. Small enough to fit easily in your back back. It will not only stop those “ Rain drops keep falling on my head” or yours, and will not turn you or your umbrella inside out with anger having your umbrella not doing what it’s to do. Great colors available. . I highly recommend this non Marry Poppins umbrella. It will not only keep you on the ground, also it will it not blow you away with the price. Very reasonable considering others on the market that have the same features, though higher priced.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Martin

customer_reviews.title: A very sturdy umbrella that can do the job in resisting heavy weather!
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella is definitely an upgrade from the dinky ones that I have. I remember one day my umbrella just folded inward or inverted and it was quite embarrassing! To me, I know there isn't anything that is really "windproof", but this can take the power of heavy gusts and rain. This saved me in those torrential down pours and heavy wind on several occasions. It can be a bit difficult to snap back after opening the umbrella, but I rather deal with that than having my umbrella break down!
customer_reviews.author: Corrin Fates

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Received it yesterday and I've already gotten a chance to use it. It works as it should though it wasn't windy outside so can't speak to it being windproof. One disappointing thing is the color. I ordered the burgundy, expecting it to be the dark red like on the screen but it is almost the exact color of the Marsala one. I checked the tag, thinking maybe I was just sent the wrong one but mine for sure says Burgundy. Regardless, I will keep it but I would probably be much happier with the red one if the colors are that different.
customer_reviews.author: Kate S.

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this umbrella since September. I purchased it for a trip to the Pacific Northwest to handle their frequent rain. Fortunately, I only need it 3 times during the trip. Since my return home it has been used several times. Earlier this week, 29 Nov 2016, the spines became tangled in threads of each other and one tore away from the fabric. I would not suggest purchasing this umbrella. I would have returned but the return period expired.
customer_reviews.author: Marypat948

customer_reviews.title: Start Searching for a Better Umbrella Again
customer_reviews.text: I was on travel with major rainstorms expected and I purchased this umbrella ahead of time. First time I pressed the extension button I felt a snap and a white cord appeared while the umbrella’s handle extended but not the umbrella itself. Tried to collapse it and could not so didn’t fit in my luggage to bring back for the return so threw it in the trash. Looked good but didn’t come thru on quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sawinsd

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: I got this umbrella to take on dog walks, which, as every dog owner knows, are rain or shine. If it's already raining, I'd likely wear my raincoat with hood, but there are lots of times that it's iffy outside, and an umbrella makes sense to have along. this one is lightweight, has a strap for carrying (easier to handle leashes), and is very easy to open. A little harder to close, but that's when I'm indoors and don't have to worry about the pups. All in all, very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: grandma408

customer_reviews.title: Rich color, great against the wind, and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this umbrella. It’s a rich, deep red. I love that with a press of a button it can open and close on its own. Once closing, you obviously have to wrap it and then push it to close. It’s definitely not a compact umbrella. When it’s closed it’s an average sized one, so keep that in mind if you’re looking for something small. It’s not the lightest but it’s also pretty sturdy. This was my first pick up where it has the second layer with those openings so wind can get through. This has been a help during really windy rainfalls/storms. I’m not fighting the rain/wind like a...Jedi?
customer_reviews.author: LooStar

customer_reviews.title: a small umbrella that provides big benefits against weather elements
customer_reviews.text: A well constructed, lightweight, short-length umbrella, that provides protection from wind, rain, and snow.Simple one-button push to open or close. Opens and closes quickly as well. When it closes, water does not drip on you. Water/snow easily runs off the material, and the unit provides full coverage with easy one hand operation. (note: the spring mechanism is strong, and you will need some effort to bring to a full close position.) I like the short length, as I can take it with me when traveling. Small enough to fit inside the door pockets in your car. (the unit also comes with a lifetime warranty!!).
customer_reviews.author: L. H. Soto

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy product. Only gave two stars for one reason really, it's too hard to close. To close this contraption you need to press the outside top of the umbrella down with your hand, a wall or the ground. If you're using it to go to the car during a shower you Will get wet as you must push down on the wet side and enjoy a lap shower as it closes. Enjoy the ride to work. Recommend for sunny days only.
customer_reviews.author: russ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and compact and opens fast.
customer_reviews.text: Living in Florida you can't live without an umbrella or 3. I needed a smallish one, got this. It's a real sturdy one, the metal shaft thru the middle is strong and will handle strong winds. It's push button, and opens instantaneously. I didn't know it, took me a while to figure it out but it closes that way too, and real fast and flawlessly so far. It seems bigger than the smaller ones, and has kind of a double top with open creases to let humidity out. I love this one, works great, strong, opens and closes fast and you can carry it easily in a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Tomazzzo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I love this umbrella! It performs amazingly in wind, it's very small and light, and I love that it pops open on its own. It is lighter than my toddler's children's umbrella. Even with the weight of hers, she has almost lost it a few times in the wind while I can easily hold onto this lightweight umbrella thanks to the ventilation layer. Some of the reviews state that it's hard to close, which is true if you try to push it shut with your hands, but I just push it up against a wall or a step leading indoors and it easily shuts.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Smith

customer_reviews.title: BEST umbrella I ever tried
customer_reviews.text: I am 75 years old and I have used a lot of umbrellas during that time but the EEZ-Y is absolutely the best. This auto open/close umbrella is well constructed and looks great. I liked it so well that I bought my sister one as well. We travel a lot together and this compact size easy to use umbrella is just right for both motor coach and cruise ship traveling. I am not a paid endorser and I know you will believe me if you buy this at the reasonable price offered by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Ricker

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a quality umbrella that I could keep in my bag at all times as I am back to school and the weather can catch me by surprise with a long, wet walk. Great size and fits well in my bag. Construction seems sturdy, no problems yet. I went with the UV protection and my wife is looking forward to taking it to music festivals. Pretty big fan of the auto open and close. I will say my eldest daughter had slight issue pushing the umbrella all the way back down after closing it because the spring is fairly strong. Me and my wife had no issue but might not be the best umbrella for kids.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Doles

customer_reviews.title: Need 3 hands to close!
customer_reviews.text: Diameter is too small. I wear a backpack a lot and both I and my bag are getting wet with this expensive thing. The most irritating thing, YOU NEED 3 HANDS TO CLOSE IT! And it is difficult to close, it must have a very strong spring in it. I find that I have to press it either against my body and use 2 hands or start closing it the normal way and then place one palm underneath the handle and the other palm on the top plastic disk and squeeze my hands together, which is ridiculous. I can’t tell you how mad I am given how expensive this thing is. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia

customer_reviews.title: I got caught in a really bad downpour with extremely high winds last week and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I got caught in a really bad downpour with extremely high winds last week and it was the first time I used the new umbrella. It is made very sturdy. I had a hard time keeping the umbrella handle from slipping out of both hands because it is so wind resistant and it didn't blow inside out despite the high winds. I still got drenched, but I don't think any umbrella can completely protect from severe rain that is blowing in every direction. I will have to see how it does in less severe rainstorms. But, it does seem to be made very sturdy and the auto open/close works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: AMD

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage... in less than a month there is already rust and 1 broken rib... only used 1 time. Thankfully I noticed the problem on the last day I could return it. DO NOT BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works great to auto open and auto close
customer_reviews.text: I used to own an umbrella that auto opened/auto closed -- and the auto close is a GREAT function when getting into the car on a rainy day. Not having to reach other and close the umbrella and get went -- but instead just push the button at the handle to close it was great. I lost that umbrella and needed another automatic close. This has a nice color and functions well. Gave it four instead of 5 stars because it is rather heavy for an umbrella -- especially to carry when it's not raining, so I keep this one in the car.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Nice umbrella but not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my middle school aged son to use walking to/from school when it rains. Loved the bright yellow color, he liked it for the color and I thought it was great because it was so highly visible to drivers. Some of the ribs bent after just a few uses but it was still usable, just slightly mis-shaped. However, after a few more uses, The open mechanism does not work. Would have been great if more durable. Positives: highly visible; nice size when open and very manageable in school back pack when closed Negatives: open/shut mechanism no longer works, probably after no more then a dozen uses.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Fusco

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful color, Minus the RUST spots
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful color, minus the rust spots. I received this umbrella less than a week ago, just in time for the April showers. When I first received the product, there was this rusty looking spot on the velcro that closes the umbrella. No big deal. So far I have used it for two rain storms just to walk to and from my car, for work. I allow the umbrella to dry hanging upside down on a hook. I waited a whole night to put it away, mainly out of laziness, and I noticed there are rust spots on the actual material. Very disappointing and very noticable on such a beautiful blue color.
customer_reviews.author: Nicola

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you dry
customer_reviews.text: Brought it as a gift for my wife. She has used it several times since receiving it. Thus far, in downpours and some good winds it has performed as advertised, She usually has her arms/hands full carrying items to and from her car to the office. The button release to open and close is the thing she really likes as it makes it easier to get in and out of the car in rain and she doesn't have to mess with it after entering the building....just press and close.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT a cheap folding umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Quality built, worth the money. However the description for the quick release open/close button is not accurate. It only works to open the umbrella, not close it. Pressing the button will quickly pop open the umbrella. However, pressing the button again will not close it at all. It only unlocks it so you have to close it manually (as described). It won't close by itself as the description seems to convey. Happy with the product, not happy with the misleading description.
customer_reviews.author: AyeSea56

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Push Closed
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella works very well on the instant open an instant close button however pushing the shaft together once the umbrella is closed is extremely difficult given the heavy spring loading mechanism. You basically have to hold it against a floor or a wall and push hard in order to get it to retract. My wife finally gave up and threw it out after it broke. I would recommend totes products. Far better built and easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: J Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and sturdy umbrella
customer_reviews.text: This is a great umbrella. It’s the perfect size to travel with and just put it in my purse. The umbrella can also fit two adults underneath. I love that it has a lifetime warranty as many umbrellas break due to the wind twisting it inside out. So far this umbrella has withstood high winds without flipping inside out. If it does I have the warrant to fall back on.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to push to fold
customer_reviews.text: I bought the yellow and I loved the color, much safer in rainy days. BUT, the folding of umbrella is sooooooooo difficult! The handle is very short and the spring is super tight, it's barely possible to hold and fold at the same time and i can never push it to the very end without getting a sore arm. I tried to push it to the wall to fold it, but the super tight spring and slippery bottom keep giving me the result of a line of black plastic mark on the white wall. Is it that I'm not getting how to use it properly? Is there a training class i should take to use it?
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Jin

customer_reviews.title: Very compact and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10-y-o daughter to keep in her backpack. It's very compact and she loves it. It has a shorter handle length, which works well for her size. Sturdy and holds up well to the strong, gusting winds we get when storms roll through our area. It has never flipped wrong side out. It can sometimes require extra effort to get it to close completely. Not sure if that is just the one that we have, or if they are all like that. Very arthritic hands would likely struggle with getting it to stay in the closed position. But, my 10-year-old can close it on her own with extra effort. My 7-y-o cannot close it by himself.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: I received this umbrella just yesterday and could tell from opening it just once that it will be a strong umbrella. I was tired of cheap umbrellas that fell apart after just a few uses. I believe this will last a very long time and hold up well. My only negative is that it doesn't come with a cover for when it is not in use. Had I known that in advance I would have kept one from an old umbrella. But still, a five star umbrella!
customer_reviews.author: Susan H

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in this umbrella. Firstly, I was sent the wrong color. I'm in the middle of the residue of our current hurricane and used it for the first time today. When I open it, it is only about two thirds the height of other umbrellas. It also has a very small coverage range. I specifically wanted an umbrella that would both open and close with the press of the button. Although the button will close the top part of the umbrella, it doesn't go back down as others do with this feature. I'm very disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RMM

customer_reviews.title: Love my umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: I have had several automatic umbrellas. This one is my favorite so far! It is not as small as some others, but it is way sturdier and does not blow back in strong wind. My only complaint is that it is extremely difficult to close. It opens and closes with the touch of a button, but to completely close it, you have to pull the umbrella down toward the handle, I have to lean it up against a wall to do this. The actually canopy part opens and closes with no problem. I would give it 4.5 stars if I could. Just a little off for the difficulty in closing.
customer_reviews.author: Rgriff

customer_reviews.title: Very big and heavy
customer_reviews.text: I think this product is way too big and heavy. Not as big as a golf umbrella but not small either. I have to buy another because this one won’t cut it. Haven’t tried it in the rain yet so I can’T comment on its quality. The woman showing it in her purse must be carrying a very big handbag. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Good coverage but hard to close
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella works fine opening & closing but the one difficulty is folding back together after closing. The instructions are to "Push both ends towards the center until it clicks". This is not easy you have to push very very hard to get it completely down into the fold. If you do not have a firm grip it can slip out of your hands. I am hoping after some use it will go more easily.
customer_reviews.author: patsand

customer_reviews.title: Good umbrella, but it breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: I kept this umbrella in my car, so I rarely used it. It seemed sturdy at first, but a 4-year-old opened it into the ground a year ago and it was all downhill from there. I was able to fix a rib that was not functioning and the umbrella worked again. A few days ago I opened it, then hit the button to "power-close," and nothing happened. I tried to push it down to perhaps reset it, but it wouldn't go down. The umbrella is just stuck open now and won't work. I'm buying another umbrella now, but giving a different company a try.
customer_reviews.author: sham365

customer_reviews.title: Incredible compact umbrella
customer_reviews.text: The incredible EEZ-Y compact umbrella is built with 9 fiberglass ribs reinforced with resin to withstand high winds and rain. The material feels strong. It is perfect for traveling, carrying in your bag, in your children's backpack, etc. Very easy to open and close with the press of a button.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the umbrella for a friend. I liked it, plus the person I gave it to loved it. Rich and deep color! Its small enough to easy carry around in your backpack and perfect for light-moderate intense rain and wind. Though, if you plan on walking through heavy rain and fighting wild winds, you are probably going to be better off getting a large, more durable umbrella, if not a full body rain coat that can be easily rolled up and stashed in your backpack. I have both and use one or the other depending on my mood :)
customer_reviews.author: Robin Om

customer_reviews.title: Great personal umbrella that is simple and functional
customer_reviews.text: The umbrella was great. very easy to use and light. The material on the umbrella portion wicks water away. Most of my umbrellas before retained water on top and it was hard to dry it off adequately. By the time I close the umbrella, it already is relatively dry. The handle is a nice rubberize one and has a good drip. The umbrella has a click functionality that makes it very easy to open and close the umbrella portion. However, the shrink the shaft it takes quite a bit of strength so be warned or use a wall or ground to push it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Le

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these umbrellas for my trip to Paris (which is a very rainy place) and they saved us from getting soaked. The only down side was that after being in the rain for a decently long time, the water started dripping through the seams of the stitching on the umbrellas...this was happening with both of them, meaning it wasn't just one defective umbrella. Other than that, they definitely helped keep us dry.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Etchevarne

customer_reviews.title: Beware! It may only work once
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these umbrellas, one primarily for travel. The size was good; it fit in the front compartment of my suitcase very nicely. The fabric seems durable and the power mechanism for opening worked great the first time. The "wind-proof" advertising seemed accurate as it had no trouble with a rain storm in Florida. I was delighted! My delight was short-lived as the second time I used it the mechanism failed; several cords popped out of the interior so I couldn't close the handle. Of course, it's useless if you can't return the handle to its compact size.
customer_reviews.author: Careful consumer

customer_reviews.title: Nice & Strong
customer_reviews.text: I had to wait until it rained before I could write a review. It does open with a lot of force, so never point it at anything you don't want broken. The shaft is strong, and doesn't wiggle. The inside spokes are made well, and not that cheap plastic you find in most umbrellas. I will update when I've used it in strong wind, as of now, I'm very happy with my purchase. Update: April 8, 2019. The second time I used this umbrella, a spoke broke. I don't know if it's the force of opening it that's causing the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Linann

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The yellow color is vibrant and attractive. It opens really well with a push of button. Even though you can close it with a push of button, it is extremely hard to push the handle back into the button lock. Good only for people with strong hands. For mine, the cover at the tip of the umbrella is missing and the stitches are exposed. So it goes back unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: SDMAMA

customer_reviews.title: HANDLING THE ARIZONA SUN AND WIND WITH EASE!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: ANDREW read my review, although it was posted several months after my purchase, and offered to make it right. As the consummate professional, he apologized and sent out a new umbrella right away. The exceptional customer service is enough to keep me as a customer. I've been using it in Phoenix, Arizona's record-breaking heat, AND it's been windy! The umbrella has handled both EXCELLENT! It is the AWESOME umbrella I thought I was buying the first time; all mechanisms working great! THANK YOU Andrew for being on top of these reviews; and for "making it right!" It is appreciated. I have faith that this replacement umbrella will stand the test of time, and HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT and YOUR COMPANY!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Button broke on the second time I used it
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella comes in such a cute yellow color, and I really wanted to like it! Unfortunately the open/close button got stuck on the second time I used it (in the middle of a rainstorm), so the umbrella would not open. Ugh! I really wish it had been sturdier. Now it doesn’t work at all and I had to throw it away. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Marina C.

customer_reviews.title: I so needed this!
customer_reviews.text: I have an over-sized umbrella that great for stormy days. But I was missing an umbrella that I could just keep inside my car and use it one non-torrential days. This was perfect. I love the quality and the bright yellow color makes me happy, even when skies are gray :) This is my first auto open/close button umbrella. Everyone else in my household had one except me. I love the ease of just pushing an umbrella, especially when you have keys, a phone and a handbag to carry. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: A.M.

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color & tough to finish closing for older folks
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a white umbrella with blue dots & received a blue umbrella with white dots! I ordered this for my 91 year old Grandma because I thought it would be nice for her to have a closing umbrella. It's not going to work for her. It only closes part way and is tough to push the rest of the way closed because of the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Oh Me!

customer_reviews.title: Compact and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella came in handy as it was raining for the past couple of weeks. The umbrella is small and lightweight which makes it super easy to carry around. One button to push open and voila I have sun or rain protection. Putting it back in the cover is fairly easy as well. Not only it is compact it is also very sturdy and feels good on my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kenn Gant

customer_reviews.title: High quality product - really good value
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting to receive a budget umbrella due to the lower price point, and boy was I pleasantly surprised! this umbrella has a very robust feel to it, with a very satisfying automatic open and close function, and flaps in place to prevent the umbrella from succumbing to strong winds. The "Ribs" are also of high quality and can seem like they can take a nice "beating" ver time. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Prolectric

customer_reviews.title: Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes these requests come too soon to rate. The umbrella looks nice. It opens and closes like expected. I really will not know how sturdy it is or how well it protects from the sun until I use it. Our travels begin in about three weeks. Hoping there won't be any rain there and not much chance to try it out at home in the hot desert sun except for sun protection. Not sure I would take a black umbrella out when it is 112.
customer_reviews.author: Bukwurm

customer_reviews.title: Nearly impossible to close! And once it clicks, ...
customer_reviews.text: Nearly impossible to close! And once it clicks, it isn't necessarily closed: It has popped open while driving more than once. Also, it seemed small compared to my other umbrellas. I'm sending it back. This company has amazing customer service! They replaced the umbrella I purchased with a different model at no cost to me. I like the replacement much better and recommend it to anyone in the market for a sturdy/large umbrella. Regardless of what you purchase, you can rest assure that they will take good care of you and genuinely care about their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Amelielucia

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Idea But With Some Issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep the blazing sun off me in the summer. Not as compact as I expected. Once you open it, do not ever expect to be able to wrap it up as tightly as it came. Therefore, that little slip cover is useless. It is really bulky. It's also extremely hard to close (surprisingly). But I do like the idea of it having a sunshade so I will keep it for that.
customer_reviews.author: Stars in Dreamland

customer_reviews.title: wonderful umbrella so I bought a second one!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second EEZ-Y travel umbrella. The first one is still in good working order, but I needed to keep one in my car and one at home for my daily walks. It handles the wind gusts just fine. I was amazed at how strong it was on my last vacation to Europe. Got caught in a downpour in Switzerland and had the only umbrella that held up to the wind and rain as compared to my fellow travelers! Thanks for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: HappyGrammie

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't collapse
customer_reviews.text: I loved this for a while, but then the threads kept wearing out, making it a fuss to wrap it up. A pain to repair. Then, after a few weeks of use, the collapse mechanism wouldn't work; one and then 2 of the ribs refused to fold. Could be wrangled a time or two, & then broke. I regret, and I see no guarantee here.
customer_reviews.author: Sisseton

customer_reviews.title: Won't close -- Seller sent me a new one!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the EEZ-Y Travel Umbrella Compact Windproof with Auto Open/ Close Button for One Handed Operation Lightweight for Easy Carrying - Fiberglass Reinforced 2 years ago and have used it maybe 3-4 times. Recently, I opened it and the umbrella won't close. It looks like the auto-open/close cord that runs up the handle is stuck. I've tried several times to get it to reset itself with no luck. UPDATE: I contacted EEZ-Y and they made good on their lifetime warranty by sending me a new umbrella--I had to register the original purchase on their site and send photos of the broken umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good compact umbrella
customer_reviews.text: Overall good compact umbrella. It’s small enough to fit into the glove box so I leave it in my car most of the time in case of sudden pours. Only complain is that it is NOT easy to push the main handle back in, and takes a bit of effort. I guess this is compensated by how easy it is to open so overall pretty happy about it. Also, I won’t have his in my purse all the time because it is definitely not light for a compact umbrella (this trait is usual for umbrelle with these automatic mechanisms).
customer_reviews.author: ValH

customer_reviews.title: Val's Review Sturdy Umbrella
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with the speedy delivery of my product. I especially like that it is compact and comes with a cover and that I am able to carry it in my purse. There has not been an opportunity for me to determine if it as sturdy as it appears to be because I have not had to use it yet in rainy and windy weather. As suggested, I do intend to register it so that I will have the lifetime guarantee. It is my hope that it is as sturdy, as advertised, and if that happens not to be so, I will inform the company EEZ-Y.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Measure before buying
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella does not provide the amount of coverage I was expecting. The description says it’s large enough for two women. That’s simply not the case, not even for two small women. I used the umbrella by myself. My criteria is that using an umbrella I get to stay dryer than with a raincoat and hat in a lightly windy rain shower. Nope, that didn’t happen. My (very small) backpack gets wet as well as my legs and part of my arms. (I’m 5’9”) I gave it three stars because the design is quite good. Unfortunately, this umbrella wasn’t worth the money to me.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C

customer_reviews.title: Umbrella Broken, Not Due to Weather
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella was fine for the first five uses. Then it stopped opening at the press of the button. It would extend but the canopy would not open so I have to keep closing it and pressing the button. That was embarrassing but I was still able to use it so the issue was manageable. However, today I pressed the button to open it and not only did the canopy not open, now I cannot retract the umbrella. Now it is going in the trash where it belongs.
customer_reviews.author: 💕 Maggie 💕

customer_reviews.title: Gret Buy, Great Compny
customer_reviews.text: We bought this umbrella to replace an older Totes umbrella and paid attention to the previous reviews. First reason was the other owners commenting that the umbrella company EEZ-Y lifetime warranty. the second reason was the manner in which one person stated that upon a problem the customer service was fantastic. After receiving this umbrella from Amazon, there was contact thanking us for the purchase and explanation of the warranty. I am sure that we will get lots of use of the umbrella. My wife loves the fact that lthough small the canopy of the umbrella expands to cover her while using it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Campana

customer_reviews.title: Great product with even better service
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to umbrella whenever it is raining as it is not only sturdy but is compact when it is put away. However my original umbrella had been damaged and when I contacted them they were quick to replace it with a new one which really made me happy. The service they provided was exemplary and it matches the quality of their umbrellas, if you need to get an umbrella I would recommend this one as it can easily fit in a bag and is sturdy in the worst rains and wind gusts.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: MuchSmallerThanExpected, Not really wind resistant.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't see or feel a difference in catching/being passive with the wind. The thing is much smaller than expected so maybe people are being fooled by that *doesn't feel as strong a pull when the wind blows). I DO like the button operation and the design is pretty solid. Still, being that it is small in circumference and that the pole (the correct term?) is also short, this would be good for a small child in my opinion. We have used it several times and if the wind is blowing at all while you are holding this umbrella, you are getting wet for sure. Not cool when you wear suits every day.
customer_reviews.author: LOCOmotivRICO

customer_reviews.title: HATE THIS UMBRELLA
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the worst purchase that I've made in a long time. When they tell you that this umbrella is compact, boy they aren't kidding! I found it difficult to open completely and once you have it open, it isn't large enough to protect you from the rain. I would not purchase again nor would I advise anyone else to.
customer_reviews.author: K. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: this umbrella looks like it's constructed very well and I love the venting ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to use it yet as, unfortunately, we haven't had much rain in Colorado this spring. But, this umbrella looks like it's constructed very well and I love the venting in the canopy to help make it windproof. It is a little heavier than I thought it would be so I might have to buy a more compact one to carry in my day pack on a trip to Italy but I will try this one out 1st in my pack to make sure it's not too heavy (having had back and neck surgeries I can't carry too much weight). But, no matter what, I'll use it here when it rains.
customer_reviews.author: Lo Becker

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to close
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy umbrella. The only issue I have is that it is very hard to get closed. When it’s raining hard and you just got in your car and you’re trying to close it it’s very hard to close it to get it to snap close at the end otherwise it’ll just bring back open saturating you with water.
customer_reviews.author: Think Positive Be Positive

customer_reviews.title: Only minimal issues
customer_reviews.text: Umbrella is OK, but having to "re-cock" it before you can reopen it after passing through a door/gate is a major flaw. Should be possible to just push it open traditionally, but you can't The only reason to have an "auto-open/close" umbrella is if your hands are full, so you can't re-cock it...... The need to re-cock greatly diminishes its usefulness.
customer_reviews.author: dgh1

customer_reviews.title: Worked 4 times before breaking But they replaced it Free
customer_reviews.text: Update: EEZ-Y gets 3 extra stars for sending me a replacement umbrella. Excellent customer service. I hope to get a lot of use out of my replacment, Thanks again. I used this umbrella 4 times at the most before it broke today. I live in SoCal so the rain is not that bad. I bought this based on the reviews so I am disappointed in the lack of quality. It is going to rain again tomorrow and it no longer opens and closes with the button. It wont let you open and close it manually, it wont lock. This was a complete waste of money. It broke when I was trying to close it and now it is useless.
customer_reviews.author: B R Whalen

customer_reviews.title: folding umbrella
customer_reviews.text: This product is fine and seems good quality. I'm still looking for an umbrella with a longer handle but it seems all the ones that fold to 12-13" are just too short. Sadly, I'm trying to replace an umbrella I had for about 15 years that got lost and all now are either small and compact or too big. This one is fine - just doesn't fit the bill for me.
customer_reviews.author: Marion

customer_reviews.title: Good size. Annoying to close and reopen
customer_reviews.text: Good umbrella, opens easily and the button to open it is convenient. The stick is not very tall, but that is expected for a travel umbrella that folds so compactly. However, it’s very annoying that after pushing the button to collapse the umbrella, you have to pull it down and close it all the way before you can open it again. So if you accidentally push the button while outside in the rain, you end up getting wet while trying to re-open it.
customer_reviews.author: ss

customer_reviews.title: FALSE WINDPROOF label
customer_reviews.text: Nice umbrella that looked sturdy, which is why I bought it right? Well, when I actually brought the umbrella with me to Japan. A strong gust of wind easily caused this umbrella to flip inside out. What is even more frustrating is to see my travel partner have no problem at all with her compact travel umbrella... Clearly the vents did nothing to help make it "WINDPROOF". I couldn't return the product because the return period past by the time I got back but I would not recommend for actual windy locations.
customer_reviews.author: Kuhaku

customer_reviews.title: Great umbrella!
customer_reviews.text: I love this umbrella! I bought it to replace a travel sized one I had that kept blowing inside out. I like to keep an umbrella in my backpack and this one is the perfect size for that without being too tiny to keep me and my backpack dry. It's held up perfectly even in decently strong wind--the wind flaps are great for that. I got the polka dot print and it's super cute. I also love that you can use to button BOTH to open and to close it. It keeps you from having to struggle with a wet umbrella while trying to get in the door.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Nice, durable, plain black umbrella that doesn't make me feel emasculated.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a man and I don't want to look like a sissy, but this will get a guy in trouble when it's raining like cow peeing on a flat rock and you're too tough to use an umbrella. This was me several times last year, and I destroyed some shoes, smelled like a wet dog, and was freezing from being drenched in my work clothes. I decided that day to put down my pride and buy a plain black umbrella. This is the least lame of all the umbrellas I've ever seen and it's super durable, packable, and does the job in a decent rainstorm.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and nice umbrella
customer_reviews.text: It has been raining like crazy and I walk our dogs daily. I needed a nice sturdy umbrella, one that would not fall apart in the wind. I ordered this umbrella and it does the job perfectly. It is very sturdy, yet not so heavy. The color is vibrant and the quality is great. Nice value.
customer_reviews.author: Keene Family

customer_reviews.title: Easy to open and close!
customer_reviews.text: My old umbrella would always stick when I tried to open it, so I decided to try this brand. I’m so happy with the quality! It’s made with thick material so it really holds up to wind and rain. The handle is easy to hold and opens and closes with ease. It comes with a little travel bag so you don’t get your car wet from the umbrella itself. It’s perfect for keeping in your car or packing away for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Leaking.... - UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this umbrella based on reviews. It turns out mine was defective. It was leaking under the umbrella!!! I'm thinking this one must have been a lemon, so I'm returning it and ordering another one. Hopefully, it will be a good one. Update May 2017: the seller customer service hand kindly reached out to me and sent me their golf dual-canopy umbrella in replacement of the one I returned. This one is much sturdier, and I like it better. Although their product quality assurance process may need improvement, the design and the materials used are excellent. So I am changing my rating from 1 start to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but not lightweight - great for car
customer_reviews.text: This is a really sturdy and super-cute umbrella which would be great if travelling by car with no space or weight constraints. Huge canopy/coverage, with a shorter than average handle/stem. I purchased it for international (air) travel, and didn't feel its usefulness would justify the weight it added to my pack.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Good, Compact Umbrella - A little Heavy Though
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella is very compact and uses a push button to open and close it. The handle is a bit heavy (probably from the push button mechanics) so it can be hard to hold one-handed, especially if you are a kid. My son has to use two hand to hold it to open and then uses the ground to push it close (you press the button to close the spread umbrella and then you need to push the extended umbrella close with your hand). The green color is very dark and the umbrella spreads for good coverage. Overall, a good purchase. If giving to a kid, then note that it may be hard to open/close depending on their age.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Not so "windproof" after all...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this umbrella based on its "windproof" description. (You wouldn't believe how many umbrellas I've had ruined by strong wind; it seems to be my lot in life.) I purchased it in August 2016 and yesterday, February 20, 2018 a strong gust of wind on my way to my car flipped it inside out and broke a couple of the inside spokes, rendering it useless. I loved the automatic open, but wished the wrist strap was a bit sturdier. I guess two years is an OK lifespan, but I was hoping to get much longer out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Remix Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect color, durable construction, excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I received my EEZ-Y umbrella in perfect condition and am very happy with the product. I have yet to use it in the rain, but it feels quite durable and well made. The design and materials are excellent quality. I was also happy it was available in the Marsala color because I find black to be very boring while patterned umbrellas can sometimes look childish. This color was perfect - professional with a slight personality. Also, I keep it in my car and with a black interior and glove box. I wanted a color that stood out visually from inside the car.
customer_reviews.author: Margarine

customer_reviews.title: THE Best!! It DOESN'T FLIP!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Boston, so we get Nor'Easters! Those winds are comparable to a hurricane! We had close to one recently and this umbrella took those MPH's like a champ,, no flipping the wrong way with this Hulk of an umbrella! Awesome technology whatever it is, i know ill stay dry and protected on those wet, windy days with this gem! Great colors too!
customer_reviews.author: A. Conway

customer_reviews.title: Just in Time for Florida "Monsoons"
customer_reviews.text: I really like the extra rib construction because here in the "Sunshine State" we get deluged by late spring and summer rains. Most are tropical depressions that include strong winds. I used to have to semi-lower the umbrella to keep it from catching in the wind and inverting. Recently this happened and ruined my umbrella, reducing it to totally useless twisted and bent ribs and fabric. Wet and unhappy, I vowed to find an alternative and found this great umbrella, and in fabulous colors too! Super!
customer_reviews.author: Eclectic User

customer_reviews.title: Boston go off light compared to both Islands and Cape!
customer_reviews.text: Because we had 30 to 40 mph winds, compared to the 70’s & 80’s! When I got home my wind resistant umbrella 1 seem got popped. So I contacted the seller. And asked if I could get the part? They said absolutely not, don’t be silly. We will send another free of charge! Shore enough I used it today! Strong winds and non stop rain! Please buy this umbrella!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: EEZ-Y Windproof Travel Umbrella - Compact Double Vented Folding Umbrella w/Auto Open and Close Button
product_meta.description:
PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Is Discontinued By Manufacturer :No
 * Product Dimensions :11.22 x 2.17 x 2.36 inches; 14.39 Ounces
 * Item model number :EEZ-101DC
 * Department :Unisex
 * Date First Available :August 16, 2015
 * Manufacturer :EEZ-Y Premium Products
 * ASIN :B01403HG8G

 * Amazon Best Sellers Rank: #632 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry)  *  #2 inFolding Umbrellas 
   
   

 * Customer Reviews:4.4 out of 5 stars6,277 ratings
feature_bullets: OUTSTANDING PROTECTION FOR BAD WEATHER! Other umbrellas flip in the wind & break immediately, but not the EEZ-Y Travel Umbrella! Made with a vented Double Canopy, this umbrella allows the wind to pass through, minimizing the risk of flipping over & breaking in strong winds!

AN UMBRELLA MADE TO LAST! Featuring a unique frame system, made of Premium Fiberglass and High-Quality Stainless Steel, this windproof umbrella does not rust or break. The strengthened Black Metal Shaft & 9 Fiberglass Ribs make it last for years to come!

THE BEST PORTABLE COMPACT UMBRELLA your money can buy! You won’t find better durability in such a lightweight, small umbrella. It folds to only 11”, so it can fit your backpack or bag. Designed with a super water repellent fabric & slip resistant rubberized handle, it can manage even the worst of downpours!

INSTANT RAIN PROTECTION! We believe ease of use is everything, that’s why our travel folding umbrella is fully automated, perfect for one-handed operation. Open & Close the umbrella with just a click of a button. No more struggling in the rain!

WHAT'S BETTER THAN THE EEZ-Y WINDPROOF TRAVEL UMBRELLA? Only our top-notch Customer Service Program! We offer 24/7 support and guaranteed replacements, just in case you ever have an issue with your new umbrella. Better products and the best in customer satisfaction. That’s the EEZ-Y way!
